author: Special Correspondent
text:
City and district police stepped up action against violations of model code of conduct by registering around 100 cases on Monday.

Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav said that 83 cases were registered under the Tamil Nadu Open Places (Prevention of Disfigurement) Act, 1959 on Monday. “We gave enough time for political parties to remove all flex boards, wall writings, wall posters and party flag masts. Now, we have started registering cases for violation model code of conduct,” he said.

The rural district police registered 26 cases on Monday alone. So far, the police have registered 103 cases in rural areas.

The police said that even flag poles of political parties and the flags should be removed from public places. “If the pole had the colour pattern representing the party flag colours that should also be removed,” Mr. Yadav added.

Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari said that writing on walls of government buildings was not allowed. “However, wall writing on private buildings with a written permission from the building owner and the Returning Officer was allowed in rural areas,” he said.

The rural district police intercepted a few vehicles carrying money. However, the money belonged to banks and those carrying the money were able to produce proper documentary evidence for the same, and hence they were let off.
title: Action against violations of model code of conduct up
